title: Stephen Swid Found a Fortune in Obscure Corners of Music Industry
text:
In a career devoted to tracking down and acquiring undervalued businesses, Stephen Swid invested in makers of carpet padding and Knoll office furniture. He and a partner tried unsuccessfully to take over Sotheby’s auction house. He owned Spin magazine and a movie-production company.

It was in the obscure corners of the music industry, however, where he made his fortune. He and two partners in 1986 paid $125 million for CBS Songs, which owned the rights to “Singin’ in the Rain” and 250,000 other tunes. After expanding the catalog...
